description: Retrieves information about all IAM users, groups, roles, and policies in your Amazon Web Services account, including their relationships to one another. Use this operation to obtain a snapshot of the configuration of IAM permissions (users, groups, roles, and policies) in your account. You can optionally filter the results using the Filter parameter. You can paginate the results using the MaxItems and Marker parameters.

parameters.name: Filter
parameters.description: A list of entity types used to filter the results. Only the entities that match the types you specify are included in the output. Use the value LocalManagedPolicy to include customer managed policies. The format for this parameter is a comma-separated (if more than one) list of strings. Each string value in the list must be one of the valid values listed below. (string) ---

parameters.name: MaxItems
parameters.description: Use this only when paginating results to indicate the maximum number of items you want in the response. If additional items exist beyond the maximum you specify, the IsTruncated response element is true. If you do not include this parameter, the number of items defaults to 100. Note that IAM might return fewer results, even when there are more results available. In that case, the IsTruncated response element returns true, and Marker contains a value to include in the subsequent call that tells the service where to continue from.

nested_items.name: UserDetailList
nested_items.description: A list containing information about IAM users.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The path to the user. For more information about paths, see IAM identifiers in the IAM User Guide.

nested_items.name: UserName
nested_items.description: The friendly name identifying the user.

nested_items.name: UserId
nested_items.description: The stable and unique string identifying the user. For more information about IDs, see IAM identifiers in the IAM User Guide.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN). ARNs are unique identifiers for Amazon Web Services resources.

nested_items.name: CreateDate
nested_items.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 date-time format, when the user was created.

nested_items.name: UserPolicyList
nested_items.description: A list of the inline policies embedded in the user.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: The name of the policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyDocument
nested_items.description: The policy document.

nested_items.name: GroupList
nested_items.description: A list of IAM groups that the user is in.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AttachedManagedPolicies
nested_items.description: A list of the managed policies attached to the user.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: The friendly name of the attached policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN). ARNs are unique identifiers for Amazon Web Services resources.

nested_items.name: PermissionsBoundary
nested_items.description: The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the user.

nested_items.name: PermissionsBoundaryType
nested_items.description: The permissions boundary usage type that indicates what type of IAM resource is used as the permissions boundary for an entity. This data type can only have a value of Policy.

nested_items.name: PermissionsBoundaryArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the user or role.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: A list of tags that are associated with the user. For more information about tagging, see Tagging IAM resources in the IAM User Guide.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key name that can be used to look up or retrieve the associated value. For example, Department or Cost Center are common choices.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value associated with this tag. For example, tags with a key name of Department could have values such as Human Resources, Accounting, and Support. Tags with a key name of Cost Center might have values that consist of the number associated with the different cost centers in your company. Typically, many resources have tags with the same key name but with different values.

nested_items.name: GroupDetailList
nested_items.description: A list containing information about IAM groups.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The path to the group. For more information about paths, see IAM identifiers in the IAM User Guide.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: The friendly name that identifies the group.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The stable and unique string identifying the group. For more information about IDs, see IAM identifiers in the IAM User Guide.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN). ARNs are unique identifiers for Amazon Web Services resources.

nested_items.name: CreateDate
nested_items.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 date-time format, when the group was created.

nested_items.name: GroupPolicyList
nested_items.description: A list of the inline policies embedded in the group.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: The name of the policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyDocument
nested_items.description: The policy document.

nested_items.name: AttachedManagedPolicies
nested_items.description: A list of the managed policies attached to the group.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: The friendly name of the attached policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN). ARNs are unique identifiers for Amazon Web Services resources.

nested_items.name: RoleDetailList
nested_items.description: A list containing information about IAM roles.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The path to the role. For more information about paths, see IAM identifiers in the IAM User Guide.

nested_items.name: RoleName
nested_items.description: The friendly name that identifies the role.

nested_items.name: RoleId
nested_items.description: The stable and unique string identifying the role. For more information about IDs, see IAM identifiers in the IAM User Guide.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN). ARNs are unique identifiers for Amazon Web Services resources.

nested_items.name: CreateDate
nested_items.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 date-time format, when the role was created.

nested_items.name: AssumeRolePolicyDocument
nested_items.description: The trust policy that grants permission to assume the role.

nested_items.name: InstanceProfileList
nested_items.description: A list of instance profiles that contain this role.
CreateInstanceProfile.
GetInstanceProfile.
ListInstanceProfiles.
ListInstanceProfilesForRole.

nested_items.name: RolePolicyList
nested_items.description: A list of inline policies embedded in the role. These policies are the role's access (permissions) policies.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: The name of the policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyDocument
nested_items.description: The policy document.

nested_items.name: AttachedManagedPolicies
nested_items.description: A list of managed policies attached to the role. These policies are the role's access (permissions) policies.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: The friendly name of the attached policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN). ARNs are unique identifiers for Amazon Web Services resources.

nested_items.name: PermissionsBoundary
nested_items.description: The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the role.

nested_items.name: PermissionsBoundaryType
nested_items.description: The permissions boundary usage type that indicates what type of IAM resource is used as the permissions boundary for an entity. This data type can only have a value of Policy.

nested_items.name: PermissionsBoundaryArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the user or role.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: A list of tags that are attached to the role. For more information about tagging, see Tagging IAM resources in the IAM User Guide.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key name that can be used to look up or retrieve the associated value. For example, Department or Cost Center are common choices.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value associated with this tag. For example, tags with a key name of Department could have values such as Human Resources, Accounting, and Support. Tags with a key name of Cost Center might have values that consist of the number associated with the different cost centers in your company. Typically, many resources have tags with the same key name but with different values.

nested_items.name: RoleLastUsed
nested_items.description: Contains information about the last time that an IAM role was used. This includes the date and time and the Region in which the role was last used. Activity is only reported for the trailing 400 days. This period can be shorter if your Region began supporting these features within the last year. The role might have been used more than 400 days ago. For more information, see Regions where data is tracked in the IAM User Guide.

nested_items.name: LastUsedDate
nested_items.description: The date and time, inÂ  ISO 8601 date-time format that the role was last used.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Web Services Region in which the role was last used.

nested_items.name: Policies
nested_items.description: A list containing information about managed policies.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: The friendly name (not ARN) identifying the policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyId
nested_items.description: The stable and unique string identifying the policy.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN). ARNs are unique identifiers for Amazon Web Services resources.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The path to the policy.

nested_items.name: DefaultVersionId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the version of the policy that is set as the default (operative) version.

nested_items.name: AttachmentCount
nested_items.description: The number of principal entities (users, groups, and roles) that the policy is attached to.

nested_items.name: PermissionsBoundaryUsageCount
nested_items.description: The number of entities (users and roles) for which the policy is used as the permissions boundary.

nested_items.name: IsAttachable
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the policy can be attached to an IAM user, group, or role.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A friendly description of the policy.

nested_items.name: CreateDate
nested_items.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 date-time format, when the policy was created.

nested_items.name: UpdateDate
nested_items.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 date-time format, when the policy was last updated.

nested_items.name: PolicyVersionList
nested_items.description: A list containing information about the versions of the policy.

nested_items.name: Document
nested_items.description: The policy document.

nested_items.name: VersionId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the policy version.

nested_items.name: IsDefaultVersion
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the policy version is set as the policy's default version.

nested_items.name: CreateDate
nested_items.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 date-time format, when the policy version was created.

nested_items.name: IsTruncated
nested_items.description: A flag that indicates whether there are more items to return. If your results were truncated, you can make a subsequent pagination request using the Marker request parameter to retrieve more items. Note that IAM might return fewer than the MaxItems number of results even when there are more results available. We recommend that you check IsTruncated after every call to ensure that you receive all your results.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: When IsTruncated is true, this element is present and contains the value to use for the Marker parameter in a subsequent pagination request.
